QuestionText.Text: Which of the following statements is probably true?
Based on the dialogue, what type of product do you think Ms. Stein's company sells?

AnswerSentence.Text: People are starting to care more about the environment.
Most people are more aware of alternative energy sources.
Industry is against the use of alternative energy.

QuestionText.Text: According to the dialogue, which of the following is true?

AnswerSentence.Text: They are studying ways to use tidal and solar power for electricity.
They are trying to restore tidal power and solar energy.
They are trying to find an alternative means of recycling.
They are examining the possibility of removing pollution caused by fossil fuels.

QuestionText.Text: According to the dialogue, what are scientists working on?

AnswerSentence.Text: Ecological practices in the industrialized world.

QuestionText.Text: What is the main topic of this conversation?

Material.Text: F1-Since the 1980s, people have become more aware of the environment. The recycling of cardboard, plastic, glass and paper has grown out of this awareness. H1-People have also finally realized that much of industry’s progress, based on the use of fossil fuels, is damaging the planet. F1-Did you know that scientists have long been trying to develop alternative sources of energy, like tidal power? H1-Yes, tidal power stations could use the power of the tides to supply households with electricity. F1-There’s also solar power, but its use is dependent on weather conditions!

AnswerSentence.Text: Animals are capable of more elaborate communication than previously thought.
Like humans, all animals can be taught sign language.
Evidence shows that most animals are capable of logic.
There is no substantial difference between humans and animals.

QuestionText.Text: What is this program trying to illustrate?

AnswerSentence.Text: To warn each other about the presence of potentially dangerous animals.
To differentiate elephants from hippos and giraffes.
To signal the start of the mating period.

QuestionText.Text: According to the speaker, for what reason do Rhesus monkeys produce different calls?

AnswerSentence.Text: It can be so subtle that humans are not always aware of it.
It is a phenomenon that has evolved recently.
Bees are the only insects that show no signs of language.
Whales are the only mammals that can sing nursery rhymes.

QuestionText.Text: What statement does the man make about animal language?

Material.Text: H1: Language is said to be one of the factors that differentiates humans from animals, but new research shows that animals use language as well. In today’s program, we’ll discover how ethologists are able to teach chimpanzees and gorillas sign language, and how Rhesus monkeys emit different alarm calls to identify predators. You may already know that songbirds alert each other with hundreds of different songs, but did you know that whales may know how to rhyme? Even elephants, giraffes and hippos, animals that were once considered to be virtually silent, communicate with sounds inaudible to the human ear. Join us on this fascinating journey!

AnswerSentence.Text: It's a methodical and precise activity.
It's a pragmatic yet intuitive field.
It's a creative and challenging process.
It's a futile and complex issue.

QuestionText.Text: From the text, what can you infer about accounting?

AnswerSentence.Text: To keep track of and sum up all transactions.
To apply for a credit or debit card.
To finance all of the accounts.

QuestionText.Text: According to Mr. Thompson, what is a ledger used for?

AnswerSentence.Text: She's hoping to get a few tips for a new job.

QuestionText.Text: Based on the conversation, why do you think the woman is interested in accounting?

Material.Text: F1: Mr. Thompson, the position I’m applying for requires a certain familiarity with accounting. Could you give me an idea of what it entails? H1: It basically consists of balancing a company's revenues and expenses. F1: Is the ledger what enables you to group together and manage all of the accounts? H1: Yes, once any credits and debits are established and the inventory is taken into account, the balance sheet is drawn up. F1: So, essentially, one has to make sure to balance all the liabilities and assets. H1: Exactly. But you need a sharp eye, because mistakes are easily made!

AnswerSentence.Text: The world of computers is developing at groundbreaking speed.
Computer science is the fastest growing academic discipline.
Computer sales have soared in the past decade.

AnswerSentence.Text: More aesthetic designs and smaller size.
Greater efficiency and bulkier disk drives.

QuestionText.Text: According to the woman, which features are associated with the new technological products?

AnswerSentence.Text: We can expect consumers to continually encounter new products.
High-tech devices will soon be replaced by computers.
Consumers ought to take advantage of the technology boom before the sector dies down.
Consumer spending will be directly related to consumer confidence.

QuestionText.Text: What does the speaker insinuate about the future of computer technology?

Material.Text: F1: Today we’ll discuss one of the fastest moving industries of our time: computer technology. In just over a decade, computers have evolved from large, immovable machines to convenient portable devices that fit in a briefcase. The processor speed and memory capacity of hard drives are constantly increasing, and traditional laptops are being replaced by even smaller and more efficient notebooks. Today’s gadgets will soon be replaced with new technology. The question is, what’s next?

AnswerSentence.Text: A renowned manufacturer of leather products.
A well-known boutique selling leather jackets.
A marketing company based in East Asia.
A producer of Japanese luxury goods.

QuestionText.Text: Until now, what type of company has Ms. Lee worked for?

AnswerSentence.Text: Regional Manager for Marketing in New York.

QuestionText.Text: Which of the following positions has Ms. Lee held?
Which of the following words best describes how Ms. Lee feels about her ability to do the job?

Material.Text: F1: I’ve been working in the luxury goods sector and have extensive experience in both marketing and management. After graduating, I was recruited by a big-name producer of leather goods in New York to work on a new marketing strategy for the Japanese market. H1: How long have you been with the company, Ms. Lee? F1: Ten years. Once I learned the ropes, I was promoted to the position of Marketing Manager for all of East Asia. H1: Did you receive any additional training to help you take on such important responsibilities? F1: The most useful training I received turned out to be a course on time management. After that, it was all hands-on training.

Dear Sir or Madam,

In reference to your advertisement in the Philadelphia Herald on February 24th, I would like to apply for the position of sales representative with your publishing company.
I am currently employed as a sales representative for an IT company. My main task is to develop and manage a client list, a role which I both enjoy and feel suited for. I am responsible for establishing contacts with potential new customers both at home and abroad, and I also conduct market research for new projects.
At the present time, I am looking for a company to fulfill the role of distributor in the Turkish market. As I already have experience working overseas, especially in the Middle East, I would welcome the opportunity to travel around the world for business.

QuestionText.Text: What type of letter is this?
Who is this letter addressed to?
Which of the following is NOT one of this person’s responsibilities?

AnswerSentence.Text: It is an honor for Mr. Hayworth to be working with Mr. Naylor.
The contract has come to an end.

QuestionText.Text: What does Mr. Hayworth's letter state?

AnswerSentence.Text: Some packages were badly damaged during shipment.
The shampoo delivered was the wrong size.
The order was five months late.

QuestionText.Text: According to the text, which of the following is true?
What kind of business does Mr. Hayworth probably have?

Material.Text:
Dear Mr. Naylor,

Mrs. McCoy has informed me that your last delivery of beauty products has arrived at our warehouse. This delivery corresponds to order 956P which we placed two months ago.
This late delivery comes as something of a surprise to us, as it is the first time that the conditions in our contract have not been honored. Your company was supposed to deliver our order before the beginning of December. It arrived over one month late.
In addition, many of the packages containing the skincare products were damaged, and the shampoo your company delivered is not the brand we ordered.
We will therefore be returning the order at your expense, and expect to be fully reimbursed for it. I would be grateful if you could send us the new order as soon as possible.

Sincerely,

Clarence Hayworth

AnswerSentence.Text: The remains of the old brick mansion.

QuestionText.Text: What do tourists who enter the Whaley House expect to see?
In the last sentence, what do you think the word "apparition" refers to?
How could the events of 1871 be best described?

Material.Text: Perhaps San Diego's most infamous house, the Whaley House has long enticed tourists hoping to catch a glimpse of the supernatural. Built in 1855 on the grounds of the former city gallows, this old brick mansion boasts a variety of otherworldly residents. Thomas Whaley, former owner of the house, was not content to end his existence when he passed away in 1890. It seems that the 1871 incident, in which Thomas's wife, Anna, was held at gunpoint while he was out of town, has forever linked his soul to the present. Some of his more common manifestations include cigar smoke (so strong that witnesses have been forced to leave rooms) or deep laughter resounding throughout the house. An <u>apparition</u> of Whaley dressed in a frock coat and top hat has often been seen at the top of the stairs.

AnswerSentence.Text: To give you energy during the day.
To help you do your chores.

QuestionText.Text: Why would you want to use Colossus?

AnswerSentence.Text: Someone who wants results without having to work for them.
A person who is not concerned with keeping in shape.

QuestionText.Text: What type of person would be most likely to buy this product?

AnswerSentence.Text: Through the use of a "hands free" clip.
By inspiring you to work out.

QuestionText.Text: How does Colossus claim to help you build muscles?

Material.Text:
Our product has numerous advantages. First, Colossus is very practical: instead of lifting heavy weights like before, now all you have to do is apply electrodes coated with nonallergenic gel to the parts of the body you wish to improve. Then, at the touch of a button, the electrodes placed on your body send electric pulses to those muscles. Colossus has a faster effect than a conventional workout, yet without any of the resulting tiredness.
Another extra benefit is the clip that allows you to hook the product directly onto your belt. Now you can train while you study, clean, iron or even in the subway on your way to work. Many companies have already launched this kind of product, but most of them have done little to no research. We, however, can honestly say that Colossus is the best on the market due to many years of scientific research.

QuestionText.Text: How many classes altogether are offered per week?

AnswerSentence.Text: At 6 o'clock on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays.
At either 6 or 8 o'clock on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays.

QuestionText.Text: When is it possible to sign up for classes?

AnswerSentence.Text: You must be enrolled at the Community Center.
You must live in the Chesapeake Bay area.
You must purchase a mat at the Center.
You must be a beginning yoga student.

QuestionText.Text: Which of the following conditions apply?

Material.Text:
Adults interested in signing up for Hatha Yoga classes should sign up at the Community Center. Classes will be offered three days a week for both beginning and intermediate students and are limited to 15 people. The instructor, Sylvie Byramjee, has taught Hatha Yoga for over 10 years in the Chesapeake Bay area.
Note: Mats and/or towels are provided.

Days Offered: Monday, Tuesday, Thursday
Time: 6:00 p.m. (Beginning) and 8:00 p.m. (Intermediate)
Cost: $120 per 10 week session*

*You can register for classes in the administrative offices found on the ground floor of the Community Center. The offices are open from 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. Monday through Friday. The Center is located on Woodland Road, 5 minutes past the intersection with Route 340. Participants must be registered members of the Community Center.

AnswerSentence.Text: Because a large number of people catch the flu each year.
Because the flu is an incurable disease.
Because each year 5,000 people are affected by the flu.
Because they want to eliminate the virus.

QuestionText.Text: According to the text, why has the Health Department decided to start administering flu shots?

AnswerSentence.Text: Only senior citizens and at-risk individuals.
Only people who have already contracted the flu.

QuestionText.Text: Who is eligible to receive flu shots?

AnswerSentence.Text: Tuesday afternoons in November and December.
Tuesday afternoons from March through October.
Tuesday afternoons from October through March.

QuestionText.Text: When are flu shots available for the elderly?

Material.Text:
The local Health Department (HD) estimates that 20% of the population is infected with the flu during flu season, which typically runs from mid-October to March. Although most people recover, approximately 5,000 people are hospitalized and 100 people die.
For this reason, this year the Health Department will begin implementation of a policy to provide free flu shots for everyone in the state. During October, senior citizens and other at-risk individuals will be targeted for the vaccine. All others will be offered flu shots during the last two months of the year.

Vaccinations are available every Tuesday from 1:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. at the State College Health Center, located at 367 Tuscarora Avenue. For more information, please look at the Health Department’s website.

QuestionText.Text: Which of the following would be the best heading for this notice?

AnswerSentence.Text: 1 piece of hand luggage and 2 checked suitcases.
1 checked suitcase and 2 pieces of hand luggage.

QuestionText.Text: How many pieces of luggage can a person take without paying a surcharge?

AnswerSentence.Text: Reschedule for another date and time after paying a fee.
Receive meal and hotel accommodations near the airport.
Pay a $100 change fee to switch flights with another passenger.

QuestionText.Text: What can passengers do if they need to cancel a flight?

Material.Text:
- We recommend that passengers check in three hours prior to scheduled departure.
- Check-in counters close 50 min. before takeoff. Passengers should be at the boarding gate at least 30 min. prior to departure. We reserve the right to cancel reservations for passengers who have not checked in by this time.
- In the event of a cancellation by the airline, passengers will receive meal vouchers and hotel accommodation at the nearest partner hotel.
- Flight times can be altered depending on availability and payment of a $100 change fee.
- Each passenger is allowed to check 2 pieces of luggage, not exceeding a total weight of 40 lbs. Any excess weight is charged at a rate of $4/lb. Only one piece of carry-on luggage is allowed, and must not exceed 20 lbs.
- All tickets are non-refundable (including taxes, fees and charges).

AnswerSentence.Text: They endanger rats as a species.

QuestionText.Text: According to the excerpt, what is one possible effect of GM foods?
What do you think “to shy away from” means?
What best characterizes public reaction to genetic engineering?

Material.Text:
Genetically modified (GM) foods are at the forefront of public consciousness. Fears range from environmental concerns to ethical debates to health issues, and studies have shown that the general skepticism is not entirely unfounded. Several years ago, a scientist named Pusztai announced that rats fed on GM potatoes had stunted growth, in addition to being more vulnerable to disease.
In many countries, consumers are strongly opposed to genetic modification, and in Europe many food producers have shied away from GM crops so as not to damage customer confidence. Such producers have realized that for consumers, the simple presence of a food product on the market no longer guarantees its safety, or the absence of “environmental risk.”

QuestionText.Text: According to the text, which of the following is an advantage of merging?

AnswerSentence.Text: The merging phenomenon reached its peak in 1999.
Mergers were at their highest point in 1996.
Mergers have increased steadily by 15% a year over the last few decades.
The number of international mergers is expected to reach 2,500 next year.

QuestionText.Text: Which best describes the merger growth curve?
How is merging portrayed?

Material.Text:
The headlong race to merge has spread to all industrialized countries. In the ten years from 1986 to1996 mergers went up by 15%, but 1996 was far from the high point. In the first quarter of 1999 alone, more than 2,500 cross-border mergers were signed. The stock market followed in their wake by pushing up the share prices of the companies concerned.
But will all this corporate shopping be good for economies around the globe? Some experts say that mergers are the result of deregulation. Fierce competition has always been a strong incentive to merge. Companies can expect to benefit from economies of scale and boost their market share. Additionally, if there's good synergy between merged corporations, increases in profits can be achieved in all areas.

AnswerSentence.Text: Women are more likely to hold executive positions in large companies.
Women own one quarter of all businesses in the agricultural sector.
In 1999, 96% of the female population worldwide earned less than $85,000 a year.
American men comprised 54% of the U.S. workforce in 1998.

QuestionText.Text: According to the survey, which of the following is true?

AnswerSentence.Text: Despite their increasing numbers in the workforce, women still earn less than men.
There are still disparities in the workforce, but men are slowly closing the gap.
The percentage of women in the American workforce exceeds that of men.
There are less female homeowners than male homeowners.

QuestionText.Text: Which statement best sums up the text’s main idea?
Which adjective best describes the salary difference between men and women?

Material.Text:
In 1999, women represented nearly 51% of the total U.S. population and 46% of the workforce. The participation rate of women in the American workforce was the highest in the world. These figures show that the gap between men and women is narrowing in the corporate world. However, large disparities in salary still remain between men and women. For example, only 4% of female homeowners compared to 11% of their male counterparts earned as much as $85,000 a year.
In 1999, 9.4 million women held executive, administrative and managerial positions. The smaller the business, the lower the percentage of women involved in decision making. Outside of agriculture, women-owned businesses represented only 1/4 of all businesses in the U.S.

AnswerSentence.Text: To create a human being with a specific genetic make-up.
To manipulate and control genetic diseases.
To serve as an infertility treatment.

QuestionText.Text: According to the text, what is the purpose of human somatic cell nuclear transfer?

AnswerSentence.Text: As an extremely delicate issue that polarizes many.
As an issue condemned unanimously by religious and political authorities alike.
As a practice that brings forth ethical and religious questions to which there is no answer.
As the most extraordinary scientific achievement of all time.

QuestionText.Text: How is human cloning portrayed in the article?

AnswerSentence.Text: Cloning procedures require that the host cell be devoid of its original DNA.
Human cloning techniques require specialized asexual cells as host cells.
Human cloning will pave the way to plant cloning.
The DNA implanted into the egg is man-made.

QuestionText.Text: Which of the following is true?

Material.Text: The controversial practice of human somatic cell nuclear transfer has been touted as one of the most extraordinary scientific developments of all time. It has been a source of violent debate among scientists and religious leaders alike, touching spiritual, ethical and legal nerves. Commonly known as human cloning, the procedure of creating an embryo consists of implanting DNA from specialized asexual cells into an egg which has had its DNA removed. The egg then undergoes chemical or shock manipulation, inducing a fertilized state which provokes the embryonic development of a fetus with the same genetic code as that of its donor. Such replication has hitherto been a natural reproductive process restricted to plants. Applying it to human reproduction has been proclaimed by many as immoral.
